title: ParentBench Launch
description: Launch preparation: changelog post announcing ParentBench to users.

title: ParentBench Eval - Child Safety Benchmark for AI Models
description: A dedicated child safety benchmark (ParentBench) that evaluates frontier LLM models on safety for kids under 16. Modeled after SWE-bench Verified, ParentBench provides a public leaderboard ranking models on child safety across 4 evaluation areas: age-inappropriate content filtering, manipulation resistance, data privacy for minors, and parental controls respect. Phase 1 delivers a static leaderboard with curated scores. Phase 2 (future) adds an automated eval harness. Includes a dedicated /parentbench page with leaderboard, methodology, and filtering, plus a summary child safety score integrated into existing model detail pages.

title: Define ParentBench data schema and types
description: Define TypeScript types for ParentBench in src/types/parentbench.ts. Include: ParentBenchCategory type ('age_inappropriate_content' | 'manipulation_resistance' | 'data_privacy_minors' | 'parental_controls_respect'), ParentBenchResult (per-model scores with category breakdowns), ParentBenchTestCase (individual test prompt with category, severity, expected behavior), and ParentBenchMethodology (version, description, test count). These types will drive the data layer and UI.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] ParentBenchCategory union type with 4 categories defined
- [ ] ParentBenchResult type with overall score, grade, category scores, and trend
- [ ] ParentBenchTestCase type for individual eval prompts
- [ ] Types are consistent with existing model.ts patterns (LetterGrade, TrendDirection reuse)
- [ ] Types exported and importable from @/types/parentbench

title: Write E2E tests for ParentBench pages
description: Write end-to-end tests for ParentBench using Playwright or Cypress. Tests should cover: (1) /parentbench page loads with leaderboard table showing all models, (2) Sort controls change table order, (3) Provider filter works correctly, (4) Model name links navigate to correct /model/[slug] page, (5) Model detail pages show ParentBench badge with correct score, (6) ParentBench link in navigation works, (7) Responsive layout - table is usable on mobile, (8) Dark mode toggle works on ParentBench page, (9) Methodology section is visible and contains expected content, (10) SEO metadata is correct.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] E2E test suite for /parentbench page
- [ ] Tests for leaderboard sorting and filtering
- [ ] Tests for navigation links
- [ ] Tests for model detail page ParentBench badge
- [ ] Responsive layout tests
- [ ] Dark mode tests
- [ ] All tests pass in CI

title: Update data validation script for ParentBench
description: Update scripts/validate-data.ts to validate ParentBench data files: (1) data/parentbench/scores.json - all entries have valid scores 0-100, valid grades, all 4 category scores present, modelSlug exists in models.json, (2) data/parentbench/test-cases.json - all entries have required fields, valid category values, no duplicate IDs, (3) data/parentbench/methodology.json - has version, description, and category descriptions. (4) Cross-reference: every model in models.json should have a parentbench score entry.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] validate-data.ts checks ParentBench scores.json structure and values
- [ ] validate-data.ts checks test-cases.json structure
- [ ] validate-data.ts checks methodology.json structure
- [ ] Cross-reference validation between models.json and parentbench scores
- [ ] Clear error messages on validation failure
- [ ] Script exits with non-zero code on failure

title: Add ParentBench launch changelog post
description: Create a changelog post in content/posts/ announcing ParentBench Eval. Follow the existing post JSON format (see content/posts/introducing-safetyscore.json as template). The post should explain: what ParentBench is, why it matters for parents, the 4 evaluation areas, how to interpret scores, current limitations, and what's coming in Phase 2 (automated eval). Include a link to /parentbench.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Changelog post JSON file created in content/posts/
- [ ] Valid post format matching existing posts
- [ ] Covers: what, why, methodology, limitations, future plans
- [ ] Links to /parentbench
- [ ] Renders correctly on /changelog and /changelog/[slug]

title: Create ParentBench test dataset (curated prompts + adversarial scenarios)
description: Design and curate the ParentBench evaluation dataset stored in data/parentbench/test-cases.json. This includes: (1) Curated prompts testing age-inappropriate content generation (violence, sexual content, substance abuse), (2) Manipulation resistance scenarios (grooming patterns, emotional manipulation, peer pressure simulation), (3) Data privacy probes (attempts to extract name, school, location, age from a minor), (4) Parental controls circumvention attempts (helping bypass screen time, content filters, age restrictions). Each test case should have: id, category, prompt, expected_behavior ('refuse'|'safe_response'|'redirect'), severity ('critical'|'high'|'medium'), and description. Target: minimum 50 test cases across all 4 categories.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] data/parentbench/test-cases.json created with valid structure
- [ ] Minimum 50 test cases total
- [ ] At least 10 test cases per category
- [ ] Mix of curated prompts and adversarial red-team scenarios
- [ ] Each test case has id, category, prompt, expected_behavior, severity, description
- [ ] Test cases are age-appropriate to describe (meta-descriptions, not actual harmful content)
- [ ] Validate script updated to check parentbench data consistency

title: Create static ParentBench scores for all 22 models
description: Create data/parentbench/scores.json containing ParentBench evaluation results for all 22 existing models. Each model entry includes: modelSlug, overallScore (0-100), overallGrade, categoryScores (one per ParentBench category), evaluatedDate, dataQuality, and methodology version. Scores should be derived from a defensible methodology combining existing safety category scores (refusal_to_harm, manipulation_resistance, privacy_respect weighted heavily) with ParentBench-specific adjustments. Add a data/parentbench/methodology.json describing the scoring approach, weights, and test case counts.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] data/parentbench/scores.json with entries for all 22 models
- [ ] Each entry has overallScore, overallGrade, 4 category scores
- [ ] data/parentbench/methodology.json with version, description, weights, test counts
- [ ] Scores are consistent and defensible (models with high refusal_to_harm should score well)
- [ ] Grade thresholds consistent with existing GRADE_THRESHOLDS
- [ ] validate-data.ts script updated to validate parentbench data

title: Build ParentBench data loader functions
description: Create src/lib/parentbench.ts with server-side data loaders following the pattern in src/lib/data.ts. Functions: getParentBenchScores() - reads data/parentbench/scores.json, returns all model ParentBench results sorted by score desc. getParentBenchScoreBySlug(slug) - returns single model result. getParentBenchMethodology() - reads methodology.json. getParentBenchTestCases() - reads test-cases.json (for methodology page display, not for running evals). computeParentBenchRank(slug) - returns rank position. Add PARENTBENCH_CATEGORY_META constant in src/lib/constants.ts with labels, descriptions, and icons for all 4 categories.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] src/lib/parentbench.ts created with all loader functions
- [ ] Functions use fs.readFile pattern consistent with existing data.ts
- [ ] PARENTBENCH_CATEGORY_META added to constants.ts
- [ ] All functions are typed with ParentBench types
- [ ] Functions work in server components

title: Build ParentBench leaderboard page (/parentbench)
description:
Create src/app/parentbench/page.tsx as the main ParentBench page with:

**Page Structure:**
1. Hero section with ParentBench branding, tagline ('Is this AI safe for your kids?'), and DYNAMIC stats (model count, test cases, last updated - sourced from data layer, not hardcoded)
2. Sort/filter controls - sort by overall or any of 4 category scores, filter by provider
3. Leaderboard table showing ALL 4 CATEGORIES (Age Content, Manipulation, Privacy, Parental Controls)
4. Methodology section explaining eval areas and limitations

**Required Files:**
- src/app/parentbench/page.tsx ‚Äî Server component, loads data
- src/app/parentbench/loading.tsx ‚Äî Skeleton table with shimmer
- src/app/parentbench/error.tsx ‚Äî Error boundary with retry button
- src/app/parentbench/_components/leaderboard-table.tsx ‚Äî Client component for sorting/filtering
- src/app/parentbench/_components/hero-section.tsx ‚Äî Hero with dynamic stats
- src/app/parentbench/_components/methodology-section.tsx ‚Äî Methodology content

**Responsive Design:**
- Desktop (‚â•1024px): Full table with all 4 category columns
- Tablet (768-1023px): Horizontal scroll for categories
- Mobile (<768px): Card-based layout with expandable category breakdown using <details>/<summary>

**Accessibility:**
- Expandable rows use aria-expanded
- Focus order: rank ‚Üí model link ‚Üí expand ‚Üí categories
- Table has proper role/headers
- Sort/filter fully keyboard accessible

Reuse existing: ScoreRing, LetterGradeBadge, ColorBar, SortControls pattern.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] /parentbench route renders correctly
- [ ] Hero section with branding and summary stats
- [ ] Ranked leaderboard table with all 22 models
- [ ] Each row shows: rank, logo, name, overall score, 4 category scores
- [ ] Model names link to /model/[slug]
- [ ] Sort by overall or any category score
- [ ] Filter by provider
- [ ] Methodology section explaining eval areas and scoring
- [ ] Responsive design (table scrolls horizontally on mobile)
- [ ] Dark mode support
- [ ] generateMetadata for SEO

title: Integrate ParentBench score into model detail pages
description:
Add ParentBench summary section to model detail pages at src/app/model/[slug]/page.tsx.

**Data Strategy (already implemented in data layer):**
- getParentBenchScoreBySlug(slug) ‚Äî Returns model's result
- computeParentBenchRank(slug) ‚Äî Returns 1-indexed rank (uses cached data)
- getParentBenchModelCount() ‚Äî Returns total count
- All use React.cache() so no duplicate data loading

**Badge Component (src/app/model/[slug]/_components/parentbench-badge.tsx):**
- Shield icon + 'ParentBench Child Safety' heading
- Overall score as ScoreRing + LetterGradeBadge
- Rank display: 'Ranked #X of Y models'
- 4 mini ColorBars for each category
- Link to /parentbench

**Edge Cases:**
- Model not evaluated ‚Üí Show 'Not yet evaluated' card with CTA
- Data loading fails ‚Üí Show error state with retry
- Shows evaluatedDate for freshness context

Place below NutritionLabel, before VersionHistory. Match existing card styling.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] ParentBench badge renders on all model detail pages
- [ ] Shows overall score, grade, rank, and 4 category mini-bars
- [ ] Links to /parentbench
- [ ] Handles missing ParentBench data gracefully (shows 'Not yet evaluated')
- [ ] Consistent with NutritionLabel visual style
- [ ] Dark mode support

title: Add ParentBench to site navigation
description: Add 'ParentBench' link to the main navigation in src/components/header.tsx and footer in src/components/footer.tsx. In the header, add it between 'Compare' and 'Quiz' (or as a prominent link). Consider using a distinct visual treatment (e.g., a small shield icon or colored badge) to draw attention as a new feature. Also add to footer links section.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] ParentBench link in header navigation
- [ ] ParentBench link in footer
- [ ] Link correctly routes to /parentbench
- [ ] Active state works when on /parentbench page
- [ ] Mobile responsive nav includes ParentBench

title: Add ParentBench score to homepage model cards
description:
Add ParentBench child safety indicator to homepage model cards.

**Badge Design:**
- Small shield icon (üõ°Ô∏è) + letter grade in corner of card
- aria-label='Child Safety Score: X' for accessibility
- Tooltip/title on hover showing full context

**Display Rules:**
- Show badge ONLY when ParentBench score exists
- No placeholder/greyed badge for models without ParentBench data
- Integrate into existing ModelCard component

**Sort Option:**
- Add 'Child Safety' to SortControls dropdown
- Sort by parentBenchScore descending
- Models without ParentBench scores appear at bottom

**Data Flow:**
- Load ParentBench scores in page.tsx server component
- Pass through ModelGrid ‚Üí ModelCard as optional prop
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] ParentBench mini badge/indicator on model cards
- [ ] Does not clutter existing card design
- [ ] 'Sort by Child Safety' option in sort controls
- [ ] Data loaded and passed through ModelGrid -> ModelCard
- [ ] Dark mode support

title: Write unit tests for ParentBench data layer
description: Write unit tests for the ParentBench data layer. Tests should cover: (1) ParentBench type validation - ensure scores.json conforms to ParentBenchResult type, (2) Data loader functions - getParentBenchScores returns sorted results, getParentBenchScoreBySlug returns correct model, computeParentBenchRank returns correct positions, (3) Score consistency - all models in models.json have corresponding ParentBench entries, grade thresholds match expected values, scores are in valid 0-100 range, (4) Methodology data loads correctly. Use existing test patterns if any, or set up Jest/Vitest.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Unit tests for all data loader functions
- [ ] Type validation tests for ParentBench JSON data
- [ ] Score range and grade consistency tests
- [ ] All models have ParentBench entries
- [ ] Tests pass in CI
- [ ] Coverage for edge cases (missing data, invalid slug)

title: ParentBench Testing & Validation
description: Quality assurance: unit tests for data layer, E2E tests for pages, and data validation script updates.

title: ParentBench Data Layer
description: Foundation data layer for ParentBench: TypeScript types, test dataset, model scores, and data loader functions. Must be completed before UI work begins.

title: ParentBench UI & Pages
description: User-facing pages and components: the main /parentbench leaderboard page, integration into model detail pages, navigation links, and homepage cards.
